item.title: [Tut] Labels and goto (loop) (intermediate)
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Ok, as usual you’re going to learn something you propably don’t know is possible in scar…
This tutorial will teach you to use labels in combination with the goto stament.
Now, in this tutorial we’re going to use them to create a loop, but you light as wedll use them to break out of multiple loops at once or something.

First let add a writeln and declare our integer to put the loopnumber in for the example:

[code]program lblTest;

var
Count: Integer;

begin
WriteLn(‘Hello’);
end.[/code]

To make our loop we’re going to declare our label “lblBack”:

[code]program lblTest;

label
lblBack;

var
Count: Integer;

begin
lblBack:
WriteLn(‘Hello’);
Count := Count + 1;
if Count < 5 then goto lblBack;
end.[/code]

Now we place the spot were the goto statement will have to jump back to and adding 1 to count for every time the loop will repeat:

[code]program lblTest;

label
lblBack;

var
Count: Integer;

begin
lblBack:
WriteLn(‘Hello’);
Count := Count + 1;
end.[/code]

Finally we use a simple if statement to check if it has repeated 5 times yet and go back if it hasen’t:

[code]program lblTest;

label
lblBack;

var
Count: Integer;

begin
lblBack:
WriteLn(‘Hello’);
Count := Count + 1;
if Count < 5 then goto lblBack;
end.[/code]

Well, that was it, enjoy it

Read full topic
